Title: A systematic study of Peucedanum nebrodense.
Abstract:
The results of a morphological and molecular systematic
investigation of the poorly known Sicilian endemic species Peucedanum
nebrodense (Apiaceae subfamily Apioideae) are presented in order to
better characterize the species and clarify its taxonomic position.
Morphological, karyological, anatomical and ontogenetic studies
indicated that this species is taxonomically well-isolated and
suggestive of an affinity with the genus Ormosolenia. This relationship
was supported through results of UPGMA analysis of 35 morphological
characters and phylogenetic analysis of combined morphological and nrDNA
ITS sequence data. The latter analysis suggests that Ormosolenia and P.
nebrodense are monophyletic sister groups, although with weak branch
support. Given its unusual life cycle, distinct suffruticose, evergreen
and dwarf habit, peculiar fruit anatomy, and possible isolated position
in the phylogenetic tree, we recognize P. nebrodense as distinct from
Ormosolenia and treat it as the new monotypic genus Siculosciadium,
namely S. nebrodense (Guss.) C. Brullo, Brullo, S.R. Downie &
Giusso.
